software.name: Tableplus
software.description: I was using Sequel Pro for a long time, but it's not being maintained anymore. So I switched to Tableplus and I love it.

software.name: Obsdian
software.description: Obsdidian is hands down the best note taking app I have used. It's a local first note taking app, which means all your notes are stored on your computer and not on the cloud. It has a lot of features and is highly customizable. The best part is that it's free.

software.name: Cleanshot
software.description: This may be the most used app on my computer. It's like the default mac screenshot app, but on steroids. It has a lot of features like annotating screenshots, recording screen, etc. It's not free, but it's worth every penny.

hardware.name: Status Between 3ANC Onyx
hardware.description: Before I got these as a gift, I thought the Airpods Pro was the best wireless earbuds. But these are on a whole different level. The sound quality is amazing, the noise cancellation is great, and the battery life is much better than the Airpods Pro. I use these for everything, from listening to music to taking calls. I highly recommend these.

hardware.name: Apple iPhone 15 Pro
hardware.description: I don't update my phone often, so getting the latest iPhone was a big deal for me. I love the camera on this phone and the new 120hz display. Its a much better iPhone 12 Pro Max I had before.

desk.name: Rode PodMic
desk.description: This is a solid microphone for streaming and discord calls. It requires an interface to work, but the sound quality is great. It's also very affordable for the quality it provides.

others.name: Xbox Series X
others.description: I was a huge fan of the OG xbox, so I had to get this one. I don't play games as much as I used to, but I still enjoy playing games on this console and Game Pass is a great deal.
